head_office_address: Piazza Trento e Trieste, 1 Teatro Comunale
eu_initiatives:
music of all kinds from classical to contemporary and from traditional to commercial forms 
women and their entitlement within the field of music 
culture empowerment and mainstreaming for composers and creators of music 
Equal opportunities for women in music
organisation_name: Fondazione Adkins Chiti: Donne in Musica (FACDIM)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
International Music Countil, UNESCO 
European Music Council 
AGIS (Music Commission), Italy 
ECSA, Bruxelles
goals__remit: With a network of associations for women composers, songwriters and creators of music in 113 countries we work to promote, mainstream and empower the music of women in all genres and all parts of the world. We maintain a growing library of scores of music by women, run festivals and concert series with women's music, advocate on their behalf at national, European and International level. We research and publish books, reports, studies and also collaborate with training institutions, schools and with universities. Active since 1978 we maintain data banks for over 27 thousand women composers and run an online Encyclopedia of living women composers.  We have undertaken several EU funded projects, the last of which WIMUST (Women in Music Uniting Strategies for Talent) was completed in December 2013.  We give scholarships to resident scholars and composers and commission up to 40 new works each year. We have also contributed to a number of White Paper Publications
relevant_communication:
We publish books with history of women in music 
and organize first performances of new works. In 2014 we published for the EUP the book "Keychanges for Women in Music and Culture" which includes a listing of all international and EU decrees, laws and guidelines referring to women and culture and women in the performing arts. 
We also interact with UNESCO and the UN.  We also promote performances of music by women (of all genres) in every part of the world and are particularly interested in obtaining performances with orchestra for women's music-
